meanings.definition: The act of covering up or glossing over wrongdoing or mistakes.
meanings.sent1: The whitewashings of the scandal were quickly exposed by the media.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often use whitewashings to hide their errors from the public.
meanings.sent3: The detective's attempt at whitewashings in the case was so obvious, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were like whitewashings, trying to hide the truth but failing miserably.
meanings.sent5: The company's whitewashings of their unethical practices couldn't fool anyone.

meanings.definition: A thin, white liquid used for painting walls or fences.
meanings.sent1: The painter applied a fresh coat of whitewashings to the fence.
meanings.sent2: The old barn looked new after a layer of whitewashings was applied.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun playing with the whitewashings, pretending it was snow.
meanings.sent4: The whitewashings on the walls gave the room a clean and bright look.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh whitewashings filled the air as the workers painted the house.
